{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.03699v1", "title": "Isotriviality of families of curves parametrized by $\mathcal{A}_g(n)$", "summary": "We prove that for every integers $g, h\geq 2, n \geq 3$, for all but finitely
many prime numbers $p$, for every field $k$ of characteristic $0$ or $p$, every
separable family of smooth projective curves of genus $h$ over
$\mathcal{A}_g(n) \otimes k$ is isotrivial. To prove this, we compute the
common vanishing locus of the absolutely logarithmic symmetric forms on a
smooth complex algebraic variety whose universal covering is biholomorphic to
an irreducible bounded symmetric domain of rank at least $2$.", "main_category": "math.AG", "categories": "math.AG", "published": "2025-05-06T17:17:47Z"}
